intro: Wrightia annamensis var. coronata, commonly known as the Annam Wrightia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its attractive, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
